Visuals for "Boolean" type attribute
A "Boolean" type attribute can take the following values: yes/no (true/false).
The System has the following attribute visuals, which can be selected when configuring an attribute on the "Visual" tab:
"Boolean attribute as a checkbox" visual
;
"Toggle" visual
;
"Boolean attribute in the form of a dropdown list" visual
.
Boolean attribute as a checkbox
This visual is used by default for "Boolean" type attributes.
With the "Boolean attribute as a checkbox" visual, the display of the Boolean attribute can be shown as a "checkbox" element.
By default, the attribute provides two states: yes/no (true/false).
When "The attribute has 3 states" toggle is active, the following attribute states are provided:
true – correct/yes;
false – incorrect/no;
null – empty value.
After configuring the visual, the attribute will appear as follows:
Toggle
The "Toggle" visual allows displaying attributes as a graphic toggle switch. To configure the visual, simply select it from the list and specify the number of its possible states.
By default, the attribute provides two states: yes/no (true/false).
When "The attribute has 3 states" toggle is active, the following attribute states are provided:
true – correct/yes;
false – incorrect/no;
null – empty value.
In the object profile, the Boolean attribute will appear as follows:
Boolean attribute in the form of a dropdown list
The "Boolean attribute in the form of a dropdown list" visual allows displaying attributes as a dropdown list with the option to select one value.
No additional configuration is required for this visual.
In the object profile, the Boolean attribute with this visual is displayed as follows:
